title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Aviation Sector, through U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

description.narrative: This definitional mission (DM) identified and evaluated opportunities in the civil aviation sector in Kazakhstan for USTDA funding consideration. Kazakhstan has experienced rapid growth in passenger traffic, particularly in its capital City of Astana, in recent years and plans to expand capacity in Astana and at least eight regional cities. In addition, building on past successful cooperation, the DM identified air traffic control projects with the Kazakhstan air navigation services provider.

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

receiver-org.narrative: U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Electric Power Sector, through Constant Group, LLC

description.narrative: This definitional mission identified and evaluated opportunities in the electric power sector in Kazakhstan for USTDA funding consideration. Kazakhstan has experienced consistent growth in electric power demand and plans to meet that demand by investing $63 billion through 2030 in power generation, transmission, and distribution, which is expected to lead to significant opportunities for U.S. companies.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Kazakhstan Rail, through U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

description.narrative: This definitional mission identified and evaluated opportunities in Kazakhstan's rail sector for USTDA funding consideration. Kazakhstan is heavily dependent upon their rail system for both the movement of people and goods. The government has made the development and modernization of the rail sector a priority and plans to invest $40 billion through 2020.

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Batys Transit Power Supply Project, through Government of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: This $744,450 grant to the "Batys Transit" joint stock company (BTTR) supports a feasibility study (FS) on a gas-fired power plant project of 25-100 megawatts of generation capacity in northwest Kazakhstan. In addition, the study is evaluating renewable power generation opportunities. The project would reduce BTTR's current purchasing of grid power to replace lost lines and potentially provide additional power to the grid in the underserved Aktobe province of Kazakhstan.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Rail Signaling and Train Control Systems, through Government of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: This $655,188 feasibility study (FS) evaluated train control and rail signaling systems in Kazakhstan. The FS studied three rail corridors (from Shymkent to Zhangaqazaly, Zhangaqazaly to Qandyaghash, and Almaty to Aqtoghay) that KazakTemirZholy, the Grantee, considers representative of its national rail network.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Early Departure Procedure, through Government of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: This $374,268 grant supports technical assistance for the development of an Early Departure Procedure (EDP) system in the Caspian Sea. This system will reduce transit times and cost for oil tankers and other vessels traversing the Caspian, and will be an important step towards the development of the Kazakhstan Caspian Transportation System (KCTS), which will allow Kazakhstan to export a much larger amount of crude oil than it is currently capable of exporting.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Kazakhstan: Maritime Coordination, Safety, And Vessel Traffic Management System Feasibility Study, through Government of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: This $388,959 grant supports a feasibility study on a Maritime Coordination, Safety, and Vessel Traffic Management System for the Republican State Enterprise "Aktau International Sea Commercial Port." This system would include three components: (1) a vessel traffic management system, (2) a long-range identification and tracking system, and (3) search and rescue capabilities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: Technical Assistance - Maritime Legal and Regulatory Systems, through Government of Kazakhstan

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Maritime Legal and Regulatory, through Government of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: This $327,844 technical assistance grant supports the assessment and development of Kazakhstani maritime legal and regulatory systems in the Caspian Sea region. These systems, once they match international norms, will allow the development of the Kazakhstan Caspian Transportation System (KCTS) to continue. The KCTS project will allow Kazakhstan to export a significantly larger amount of crude oil than currently is possible to Azerbaijan for further transmission through the Baku-Tbilisi-Ceyhan and Baku-Supsa pipelines.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Monitoring and Diagnostic Systems, through Government of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: This $392,436 technical assistance (TA) grant supported the assessment of transmission line monitoring and diagnostic systems in Kazakhstan, and the development of technical specifications for new equipment. The TA will contribute to reduction of line losses and improving operational and maintenance programs of the Kazakhstan Electricity Grid Operating Company.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Rail Information Technology Integration and Development, through Government of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: This $437,000 grant to the national railway company of Kazakhstan "Kazakhstan Temir Zholy" JSC (KTZ), supports technical assistance (TA) to implement modern information technology (IT) systems. This TA will help KTZ as it consolidates its 14 subsidiaries into three departments covering freight, passenger, and infrastructure. By improving IT systems, KTZ will be able to improve operational efficiency and provide real-time data to its senior management that will aid in improving safety.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - RAIL TECHNOLOGY ORIENTATION VISIT, through TERA International Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This $219,520 orientation visit of Kazakh rail officials assists U.S. businesses in presenting U.S. railway solutions. The OV allows Kazakh officials to gain exposure to U.S. advanced railway technology used in areas such as train control, power supply, track maintenance, and multimodal rail facilities. The OV includes site visits of U.S. facilities and meetings with leading U.S. companies and U.S. Government agencies active in the rail sector.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - SMART GRID REVERSE TRADE MISSION, through MFM Lamey Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $215,747 orientation visit (OV) of Kazakh electric power transmission officials assists U.S. businesses in presenting U.S. smart grid and other transmission solutions. The OV allows Kazakh officials to gain exposure to U.S. Smart Grid and advanced electric power transmission technology used in areas such as diagnostic systems, supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) and loss reduction technology. The OV includes visits of U.S. facilities and meetings with leading U.S. companies and U.S. Government agencies active in the electric power transmission sectors.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: This $388,959 grant funds a feasibility study on a Maritime Coordination, Safety, and Vessel Traffic Management System for the Republican State Enterprise "Aktau International Sea Commercial Port." This system would include three componenets: (1) a vessel traffic management system, (2) a long-range identification and tracking system, and (3) search and rescue capabilities.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - INTEGRATED GAS PRODUCTION AND PROCESSING FEASIBILITY STUDY, through Government of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: This $626,000 feasibility study grant allows JSC KazTrans Gas to determine the economic, technical and financial feasibility of an integrated production and processing project for helium, nitrogen and natural gas. This project will allow KazTransGas to monetize their deposits and produce more relatively clean burning natural gas, while contributing to the reduction in worldwide shortages of helium.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Gas Utilization Reverse Trade Mission, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: This $252,548 reverse trade mission (RTM) of Kazakhstan gas sector officials assists U.S. businesses in presenting U.S. gas utilization solutions. The RTM allows Kazakhstan officials to gain exposure to U.S. technology and practice in gas utilization including power production, gas processing, and small scale LNG for distribution. The RTM includes visits to U.S. facilities and meetings with leading U.S. companies and U.S. Government agencies active in the oil and gas sector.
